verses.verse: And Miriam<WH4813> and Aaron<WH175> spoke<WH1696> against Moses<WH4872> because<WH5921> <WH182> of the Ethiopian<WH3569> woman<WH802> whom<WH834> he had married:<WH3947> for he had married<WH3947> an Ethiopian<WH3569> woman.<WH802>
And they said,<WH559> Has the LORD<WH3068> indeed spoken<WH1696> only<WH7535> by Moses?<WH4872> has he not spoken<WH1696> also<WH1571> by us? And the LORD<WH3068> heard<WH8085> it.
(Now the man<WH376> Moses<WH4872> was very<WH3966> meek,<WH6035> above all<WH3605> the men<WH120> which<WH834> were on the face<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>)

And the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH559> suddenly<WH6597> to Moses,<WH4872> and to Aaron,<WH175> and to Miriam,<WH4813> Come<WH3318> out you three<WH7969> to the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation.<WH4150> And they three<WH7969> came<WH3318> out.

And the LORD<WH3068> came<WH3381> down<WH3381> in the pillar<WH5982> of the cloud,<WH6051> and stood<WH5975> in the door<WH6607> of the tabernacle,<WH168> and called<WH7121> Aaron<WH175> and Miriam:<WH4813> and they both<WH8147> came<WH3318> forth.

And he said,<WH559> Hear<WH8085> now<WH4994> my words:<WH1697> If<WH518> there be a prophet<WH5030> among you, I the LORD<WH3068> will make myself known<WH3045> to him in a vision,<WH4758> and will speak<WH1696> to him in a dream.<WH2472>
My servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872> is not so,<WH3651> who<WH1931> is faithful<WH539> in all my house.<WH1004>

With him will I speak<WH1696> mouth<WH6310> to mouth,<WH6310> even apparently,<WH4758> and not in dark<WH2420> speeches;<WH2420> and the similitude<WH8544> of the LORD<WH3068> shall he behold:<WH5027> why<WH4069> then were you not afraid<WH3372> to speak<WH1696> against my servant<WH5650> Moses?<WH4872>
And the anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against them; and he departed.<WH3212>

And the cloud<WH6051> departed<WH5493> from off<WH5921> the tabernacle;<WH168> and, behold,<WH2009> Miriam<WH4813> became leprous,<WH6879> white as snow:<WH7950> and Aaron<WH175> looked<WH6437> on Miriam,<WH4813> and, behold,<WH2009> she was leprous.<WH6879>

And Aaron<WH175> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> Alas,<WH994> my lord,<WH113> I beseech<WH4994> you, lay<WH7896> not the sin<WH2403> on us, wherein<WH834> we have done foolishly,<WH2973> and wherein<WH834> we have sinned.<WH2398>
Let her not be as one dead,<WH4191> of whom the flesh<WH1320> is half<WH2677> consumed<WH398> when<WH834> he comes<WH3318> out of his mother's<WH517> womb.<WH7358>
And Moses<WH4872> cried<WH6817> to the LORD,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> Heal<WH7495> her now,<WH4994> O God,<WH410> I beseech<WH4994> you.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> If her father<WH1> had but spit<WH3417> in her face,<WH6440> should she not be ashamed<WH3637> seven<WH7651> days?<WH3117> let her be shut<WH5462> out from the camp<WH4264> seven<WH7651> days,<WH3117> and after<WH310> that let her be received<WH622> in again.
And Miriam<WH4813> was shut<WH5462> out from the camp<WH4264> seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117> and the people<WH5971> journeyed<WH5265> not till<WH5704> Miriam<WH4813> was brought<WH622> in again.
And afterward<WH310> the people<WH5971> removed<WH5265> from Hazeroth,<WH2698> and pitched<WH2583> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Paran.<WH6290>
